data.title: Kennedy Center
data.text:
Monica Warr, a Washington DC native, boasts two decades of experience as a versatile director, teacher, choreographer, and creative director. Her journey started at the age of 5, training at renowned studios such as Broadway Dance Center, Millennium Dance Complex, Debbie Reynolds, and The Edge. Monica's expertise extends to working as a dance instructor in the DC public school system and at competitive dance studios.

With a rich dance background, Monica has worked with many established artists like Diddy, Monica, and Dr. Dre, showcasing her talents on networks such as MTV, BET, TV One, and in movies like "Step Up" and "Bolden." As a principal dancer on MTV's Video Music Awards, Monica has honed her skills under the guidance of top choreographers including Laurie Ann Gibson, Devyne Stephens, Zach Woodlee, and more.

As a choreographer and creative director, Monica has developed "The Monica Warr Formula," a unique curriculum focused on teaching clients the art of performance. Her dance artists have gone on to collaborate with industry giants like Beyonce, Rihanna, Usher, and many others. Monica's dedication to the arts extends beyond her own achievements; she is the Founder/Artistic Director of WARR Dance Company, recognized by FOX NEWS, The Ellen Show, Essence Magazine, and others.

As a proven leader and arts administrator, Monica Warr continues her mission of artistic excellence and community engagement. Her company, WARR Dance Company, aims to empower the future of dance by bridging the gap between classical technique and commercial dance, making it accessible to all. Through training workshops, showcases, and artist development, Monica has been leveling the playing field for young dance artists from diverse backgrounds.

In 2022, Monica opened a commercial talent management agency in Washington DC, leveraging her experience and connections to put Washington DC area talents on major productions like award shows and movies. She is also venturing into producing large-scale events, currently working on the March on Washington, bringing in major acts to perform on Black Lives Matter Plaza. Monica's dedication to elevating the arts in Washington DC makes her a driving force in making the area a thriving hub for arts and entertainment.
